security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation about security best practices. No executable code, no scripts, no network operations, no data collection. Provides educational guidance on OWASP Top 10, authentication, authorization, cryptography, and vulnerability detection.

content.user_title: Detect vulnerabilities and secure your code
content.value_statement: Application security vulnerabilities can lead to data breaches and system compromise. This skill provides expert guidance on OWASP Top 10, secure authentication, authorization patterns, cryptography, and vulnerability remediation to help you build and maintain secure applications.
actual_capabilities: Detect common vulnerabilities (SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, SSRF)
Guide secure coding practices and cryptography
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files
Provides guidance only, requires developer implementation
Does not perform automated penetration testing
Knowledge limited to documented security patterns

use_cases.title: Secure Code Development
use_cases.description: Learn secure coding practices to prevent vulnerabilities in your applications.

use_cases.title: Security Code Reviews
use_cases.description: Conduct thorough security audits of authentication, authorization, and data protection code.

use_cases.title: Security Integration
use_cases.description: Implement security best practices in CI/CD pipelines and cloud deployments.

prompt_templates.title: Vulnerability Scan
prompt_templates.scenario: Check code for SQL injection risks
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this code for SQL injection vulnerabilities. Look for string concatenation in queries, unparameterized statements, and suggest prepared statement fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Auth Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the authentication code for security issues. Check password storage, session management, MFA implementation, and brute force protection.

prompt_templates.title: Secure Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Help design a secure authentication flow for a new feature. Include session management, token handling, and protection against common attacks.

prompt_templates.title: Incident Response
prompt_templates.prompt: We found a vulnerability in our code. Provide detailed remediation steps for [specific vulnerability type] including code examples and verification steps.

output_examples.input: Review this authentication code for security issues
output: ‚ö†Ô∏è Missing account lockout after failed attempts
Recommendations: Add progressive delays after failed logins, implement TOTP-based MFA for sensitive accounts.

best_practices: Always validate and sanitize user input on the server side
Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection
Store passwords with modern hashing (Argon2id or bcrypt)
Implement defense in depth with multiple security layers
anti_patterns: Storing passwords in plain text or with weak hashing (MD5, SHA1)
Concatenating user input directly into SQL queries
Trusting client-side validation for security decisions
Exposing sensitive data in error messages or logs

faq.question: Which languages and frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill covers security patterns for Node.js, Python, Java, C#, PHP, and Go with framework-specific examples for Express, Django, Spring, and .NET.

faq.question: What is the OWASP Top 10 coverage?
faq.answer: All OWASP Top 10 2021 categories are covered including Broken Access Control, Cryptographic Failures, Injection, Insecure Design, and SSRF.

faq.question: Can this skill replace manual security testing?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance and recommendations. Automated scanning tools and manual penetration testing are still required for comprehensive security assessment.

faq.question: Is my code data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. All code analysis happens locally within the Claude environment. No code or data is transmitted to external servers.

faq.question: How do I get started with a security audit?
faq.answer: Share the code you want reviewed and specify your focus area. The skill will provide a structured audit with severity ratings, affected locations, and remediation steps.

faq.question: How does this compare to SAST tools?
faq.answer: SAST tools automate pattern matching. This skill provides contextual analysis, explains why vulnerabilities are dangerous, and guides secure implementation with examples.
